title: J86-4002

sentences.text: The goal of this work is the enrichment of human-machine interactions in a natural language environment .

Because a speaker and listener can not be assured to have the same beliefs , contexts , perceptions , backgrounds , or goals , at each point in a conversation , difficulties and mistakes arise when a listener interprets a speaker 's utterance .
These mistakes can lead to various kinds of misunderstandings between speaker and listener , including reference failures or failure to understand the speaker 's intention .
Such mistakes can slow , and possibly break down , communication .
Our goal is to recognize and isolate such miscommunications and circumvent them .
This paper highlights a particular class of miscommunication -- reference problems -- by describing a case study and techniques for avoiding failures of reference .
We want to illustrate a framework less restrictive than earlier ones by allowing a speaker leeway in forming an utterance about a task and in determining the conversational vehicle to deliver it .
The paper also promotes a new view for extensional reference .

summary: The goal of this work is the enrichment of human-machine interactions in a natural language environment . Because a speaker and listener can not be assured to have the same beliefs , contexts , perceptions , backgrounds , or goals , at each point in a conversation , difficulties and mistakes arise when a listener interprets a speaker 's utterance . These mistakes can lead to various kinds of misunderstandings between speaker and listener , including reference failures or failure to understand the speaker 's intention . We call these misunderstandings miscommunication . Such mistakes can slow , and possibly break down , communication . Our goal is to recognize and isolate such miscommunications and circumvent them . This paper highlights a particular class of miscommunication -- reference problems -- by describing a case study and techniques for avoiding failures of reference . We want to illustrate a framework less restrictive than earlier ones by allowing a speaker leeway in forming an utterance about a task and in determining the conversational vehicle to deliver it . The paper also promotes a new view for extensional reference .

Predicate-can_not_be_assured_to_have.label: can not be assured to have
Predicate-can_not_be_assured_to_have.description: This predicate indicates a lack of certainty or guarantee that the subject possesses or has access to the object. It implies that there may be uncertainty or doubt about whether the subject truly holds, owns, or experiences the object in question.

Predicate-can_lead_to.label: can lead to
Predicate-can_lead_to.description: The predicate 'can lead to' indicates a causal relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the state or situation described by the subject has the potential to result in, or bring about, the outcome denoted by the object. In general, this predicate implies a logical connection where one thing (the subject) can cause another thing (the object) to happen.

Predicate-including.label: including
Predicate-including.description: The predicate 'including' indicates that the subject (in this case, misunderstandings between a speaker and a listener) encompasses or comprises one or more specific instances or examples of itself. In other words, it provides a non-exhaustive list of possible manifestations or types of the subject.

Predicate-call.label: call
Predicate-call.description: The predicate 'call' indicates a conceptual connection or association between the subject (in this case, 'We') and the object ('various kinds of misunderstandings'), suggesting that the subject has identified or recognized the existence of these misunderstandings.

Predicate-slow_down.label: slow down
Predicate-slow_down.description: To slow down means to cause or contribute to a decrease in speed, pace, or tempo of something. It implies an influence on the subject that leads to a slowing down effect on the object.

Predicate-break_down.label: break down
Predicate-break_down.description: To break down a predicate means to reduce or decompose something into its constituent parts, often resulting in a loss of cohesion or coherence. This can be applied to various domains such as ideas, concepts, systems, or even physical structures.

Predicate-highlights.label: highlights
Predicate-highlights.description: To highlight something means to draw attention to its most important or distinctive features, emphasizing what makes it stand out from others. In this sense, the predicate 'highlights' connects the subject (the entity being described) with an object that represents a particular aspect, characteristic, or feature of the subject.

Predicate-highlights_a_particular_class_.label: highlights a particular class of miscommunication -- reference problems
Predicate-highlights_a_particular_class_.description: The predicate 'highlights a particular class of miscommunication -- reference problems' indicates that the subject (e.g., an article, study, or research paper) draws attention to and focuses on a specific type of communication issue related to referencing or citation. This connection highlights how the subject sheds light on the object ('reference problems'), emphasizing its significance in understanding the nature of these miscommunications.

Predicate-promotes.label: promotes
Predicate-promotes.description: Promotes indicates that the subject (in this case, The paper) supports or advocates for the object (a new view for extensional reference), often by providing a platform or means to disseminate and gain recognition for it.

Predicate-recognize_and_isolate_such_mis.label: recognize and isolate such miscommunications
Predicate-recognize_and_isolate_such_mis.description: To predicate 'recognize and isolate such miscommunications' means to identify and separate instances of ineffective or unclear communication from a larger context. This action connects the subject (the entity performing the recognition) with the object (miscommunications), implying that the subject is actively seeking out, distinguishing, and possibly addressing these issues in order to improve understanding or resolve conflicts.

Predicate-want_to_illustrate_a_framework.label: want to illustrate a framework less restrictive than earlier ones by allowing a speaker leeway in forming an utterance about a task and in determining the conversational vehicle to deliver it
Predicate-want_to_illustrate_a_framework.description: This predicate describes the subject's intention to present or demonstrate a framework that offers more flexibility than previous ones. The speaker wants to convey their idea about a task in a way that allows for creative expression and choice of communication method, rather than being constrained by traditional structures.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' connects the subject to a written or verbal representation of information about something (the object), indicating that the subject provides an explanation, summary, or account of the object.

Predicate-can_lead.label: can lead
Predicate-can_lead.description: The predicate 'can lead' indicates a causal relationship between the subject (various kinds of misunderstandings) and the object (the paper), suggesting that these misunderstandings have the potential to result in or contribute to the creation, development, or consequences described by the paper.

Predicate-describe.label: describe
Predicate-describe.description: To describe a subject means to provide a detailed and informative account of its characteristics, features, or properties. The predicate 'describe' connects the subject with an object that contains information about the subject's nature, attributes, or aspects.

Predicate-This_paper_highlights.label: This paper highlights
Predicate-This_paper_highlights.description: This predicate indicates that the subject (a written work or document) emphasizes or draws attention to specific aspects, features, or phenomena represented by the object. The connection between the subject and object suggests a highlighting function, where the subject serves as a container for important information, and the object represents the key takeaways or main points being highlighted.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject is a specific instance or subclass of a more general category or class denoted by the object. It establishes a hierarchical relationship between the two, where the subject is a narrower concept within the scope of the object.
